result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. LeRon K. May

records.addlTxt:
Defendant LeRon K. May in court.  Attorney David Rudolph Berman in court for LeRon K. May.  Prosecuting attorney Rosa Delgado in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk JT  Minutes: DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:07 PM
Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney David Berman. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am. Bond continued as previously set. ec

at the request of Atty Berman STC on 09-21 is rescheduled to 09-22-22 at 1pm Intake.  DA notified.
Status conference on September 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, LeRon K. May, appeared.  Attorney Drew Lehman appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Applicant is eligible for services, no attorney assigned.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Weapons especially firearms.   No drug paraphenalia.   No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Carmen I.

01:34 PM    Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.  $1000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  ts
